div.p:
I return the sheets
corrected by your
literary friend and
would like you to
ask him to com-
pare his corrections
with the 4th Revise!
which I have polished
& repolished and
better polished until
I thought it was
perfect more perfect
& most perfect. I see
that several of your
friend's corrections
are improvements.
I added a few words
about the Ma Robert
which make it
plain - and a note
to shew what he
had better do with
the 4th Revise.

Oswell does not
pretend to be literary
but has good taste
and a great know-
ledge of African
affairs. His help
need not interfere
with that of your
friend. Professor
Owen looks over the
natural history
parts & is pleased
with it.

The artist has done
very well with
bellows - net
arrowhead - and
Shupanga house.
He might make
one of the figures
in the hoeing scene
a little less apish.
Baines could not
draw human
figures without
caricaturing them.
I send continuation
of matter for your
friend - 17a - 32a
3d Revise.

I have asked Mr Clowes
to send me the matter
following and contents
if printed as early as
possible - the want
of which puzzles me
greatly.

In 4th revise the
place for woodcuts
are all marked -
the fish basket is
wrong if the artist had
the block back I would
ask Waller again to call.
Oswell will send 4th
revise to you - then in future
if your friend sends
what corrections he may make to me & Oswell
Do I will incorporate from Oswell
any thing of value from O.
into his and
send one set
alone to printer.
